data.text:
Publication downloads available under "Publications" tab

RICHARD J. ZECKHAUSER

Books and Edited Books

Benefit Cost and Policy Analysis Annual 1974, principal editor, Chicago: Aldine Publishing Company. 1974 Introduction written with Albert Nichols. Co-editor of 1971, 1972, 1973 volumes.

A Primer for Policy Analysis, with Edith Stokey, New York: W.W. Norton & Company, 1978.

Demographic Dimensions of the New Republic: American Interregional Migration, Vital Statistics, and Manumissions, 1800-1860, with Peter D. McClelland, New York: Cambridge University Press, 1982.

What Role for Government?: Lessons from Policy Research, editor, with Derek Leebaert, Durham, NC: Duke University Press, 1983.

Principals and Agents: The Structure of Business, editor, with John W. Pratt, Boston: Harvard Business School Press, 1985; paperback, 1991.

American Society: Public and Private Responsibilities, editor, with Winthrop Knowlton, Cambridge, MA: Ballinger Publishing Company, 1986.

Privatization and State-Owned Enterprises: Lessons from the United States, Great Britain, and Canada, editor, with Paul W. MacAvoy, William T. Stanbury, and George Yarrow, Boston: Kluwer Academic Publishers, 1989.

Strategy and Choice, editor, Cambridge, MA: MIT Press, 1991.

Wise Choices: Decisions, Games, and Negotiations, editor with Ralph L. Keeney and James K. Sebenius, Boston: Harvard Business School Press, 1996.

The Early Admissions Game: Joining the Elite, with Christopher Avery and Andrew Fairbanks, Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Press, 2003.

Targeting in Social Programs: Avoiding Bad Bets, Removing Bad Apples, with Peter H. Schuck, Washington, DC: Brookings Institution Press, 2006.

The Patron's Payoff: Conspicuous Commissions in Italian Renaissance Art, with Jonathan K. Nelson, Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 2008.

Collaborative Governance: Private Roles for Public Goals, with John D. Donahue, Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 2011.

The Dragon, the Eagle, and the Private Sector: Public-Private Collaboration in China and the United States, with Karen N. Eggleston and John D. Donahue, Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2021. Webinar: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OGfoc8-zEiE

Risks in Renaissance Art: Production, Purchase, and Reception, with Jonathan Nelson, Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2024.

Articles

1. "An Economic Theory of Alliances," with Mancur Olson, Jr., Review of Economics and Statistics 48(3), August 1966, 266-279. Also reprinted in Alliances: Latent War Communities in the Contemporary World, Francis Beer (ed.), New York: Holt, Rinehart and Winston, 1970; in Economic Theories of International Politics, Bruce M. Russett (ed.), Chicago: Markham, 1968; in The Economic Approach to Politics: An Introductory Reader, Bruno S. Frey (ed.), Tubingen, Germany: J.C.B. Mohr; in The Economics of Defence, Keith Hartley and Todd Sandler (eds.), Cheltenham, U.K.: Edward Elgar Publishing, 2001.

2. "Collective Goods, Comparative Advantage, and Alliance Efficiency," with Mancur Olson, in Issues in Defense Economics, Roland N. McKean (ed.), New York: National Bureau of Economic Research, Columbia University Press, 1967, 25-48.

3. "Some Thoughts on The Allocation of Resources to Bio-Medical Research," U.S. Department of Health, Education, and Welfare, Office of the Assistant Secretary for Planning and Evaluation, Occasional Paper No. 4, November 9, 1967.

4. "Optimality in a World of Progress and Learning," Review of Economic Studies 35(3), July 1968, 363-365.

5. "Public Policy and Normative Economic Theory," with Elmer Schaefer, in The Study of Policy Formation, Raymond A. Bauer and Kenneth J. Gergen (eds.), New York: The Free Press, 1968, Chapter 2, 27-101.

7. "Uncertainty and the Need for Collective Action," in The Analysis and Evaluation of Public Expenditures: The PPB System, Joint Economic Committee, U.S. Congress, vol. 8, Washington, DC: U.S. Government Printing Office, 1969, 149-166. Also reprinted in Public Expenditure and Policy Analysis, Robert Haveman and Julius Margolis (eds.), Chicago: Markham, 1970, Chapter 4, 96-116.
